text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Iraqi press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President Saddam Hussein adds 50 percent to the monthly salaries of government employees to be deposited in banks as savings for the future.
- U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Annan recommends the renewal of the oil-for-food deal.
- Iraq and China start oil negotiations.
- Arab League denounces again the Turkish incursion of northern Iraq.
- National Assembly discusses Iraq's relations with the U.N. Security Council.
- Iraq protests against violations by U.S. warplanes of its air space.
(The above were also carried by JUMHOURIYA and AL-IRAQ)
- Article and commentary slam Turkish invasion of northern Iraq.
- Article says U.S. defence of human rights is a big lie.
- Vice-President Taha Yassin Ramadan receives Chinese delegation.
- Iraqi court sentences to death three thieves who murdered two people.
- Commentary expounds aims and incentives behind latest Turkish aggression against Iraq.
